instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no image (internal or external).

I have fan spin, USB activity, all voltages on big coils are present, but no image.

Can you help?

No, I didnÂ´t replaced it. I'll do it right away.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message: I' don't have any <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board, and i can't find any cap with that size and value on other boards (however, this one seams to be ok). Can i replace it by one of 220uf (<CAPACITOR>C2491</CAPACITOR>) from an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board, just for test propose?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
You can use normal size capacitor.
Just need to scratch the trace paint; moving a bit the coil, you get even more space.
Do not use recovered small cap from other 2850 board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
TKS. That solved it!

Thanks again!
